ground_truth: As the blonde man draws closer, Dillinger grabs him in a chokehold and aims a gun at Gilbert. He cocks his head. D'Andrea looks at Gilbert whose hand rests on his gun. He turns to Dillinger and Red. Dillinger tosses the blonde man away. D'Andrea sits calmly on the edge of a desk. Dillinger holsters his gun. Dillinger knits his brow thoughtfully then meets D'Andrea's gaze. D'Andrea shrugs. Dillinger glares at D'Andrea, his lips curved into a frown. The mustached gangster leans in closer. Dillinger tilts his head, his eyes narrowing as he meets D'Andrea's gaze. He turns away. Dillinger and Red exit. Now, Hoover and Purvis walk down a hall. Outside, Hoover turns from Purvis and heads over to a group of well-dressed boys standing in two lines. They shake hands. Hoover faces the press. In a movie theatre, the event plays on a newsreel. Dillinger talks to the rugged gangster. Dillinger nods his head at Shouse. A photo of Dillinger appears onscreen. Dillinger subtly covers his face. Shouse stands and Red yanks him back into his seat. Homer looks away nervously. As Dillinger sits with a worried look, his face tilted down, the overhead light turns on, bathing the audience member's faces. The audience turns, peering at the people to the right. The audience turns again. As the audience members settle their eyes back toward the front, the lights fade down and a new story begins. Tommy turns to Dillinger. Dillinger rubs his lips thoughtfully as he looks at Tommy and nods. He exchanges a glance with Red and they rise, grabbing their coats. A few rows ahead, Homer puts on his hat and steps into the aisle behind them. As they exit the theater, Red moves closer to Dillinger. People mill around a town square. A stiff wind flutters the awnings of a storefront. On the far side of the square, a policeman pulls up on a motorcycle. Inside a bank, Baby Face stands on a table and fires his gun through a window at the policeman. He fires at the ceiling. Outside, Homer grabs a man and holds him hostage. Inside, Dillinger and Tommy exchange an exasperated look. From inside a vault, Dillinger tosses a bag to Tommy. He guides the bank president by the shoulder. A woman joins the bank president. The gangsters shield themselves with the hostages as they exit the bank. They pass Homer, who waits outside by their car with his own hostage. Baby Face fires wildly into the town square. Two men dive to the ground. From a window across the street, a man aims a gun. Dillinger lurches forward, his eyes wide. He drops to a seated position, his gun still raised, then notices Tommy who lies on his stomach in a pool of blood.

The audience glances over at the individuals to the left. The audience glances again. As the audience members settle their eyes back toward the screen, the lights dim and a new scene unfolds. Billy turns to Reynolds. Reynolds massages his chin thoughtfully as he gazes at Billy and nods. He shares a look with Blue and they stand, pulling on their jackets. A few seats ahead, Charlie dons his cap and steps into the aisle behind them. As they depart the cinema, Blue moves nearer to Reynolds. People meander around a park. A strong breeze flaps the banners of a kiosk. On the far side of the park, a fireman pulls up on a bicycle. Inside a shop, Baby Face perches on a counter and fires his water gun through a window at the fireman. He sprays at the lights. Outside, Charlie grabs a woman and grips her as leverage. Inside, Reynolds and Billy trade an irritated glance. From inside a closet, Reynolds tosses a sack to Billy. He guides the shop manager by the elbow. A child joins the shop manager. The burglars shield themselves with the hostages as they leave the shop. They pass Charlie, who waits outside by their bicycle with his own hostage. Baby Face sprays indiscriminately into the park. Two women dive toward the ground. From a window across the path, a woman wields a water balloon. Reynolds charges forward, his eyes wide. He drops to a crouching position, his camera still aimed, then notices Billy who lies on his side in a puddle of paint.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: As the blonde man approaches, Dillinger envelops him in a bear hug and points a stick at Gilbert. He tilts his shoulder. D'Andrea glances at Gilbert whose hand sits atop his knife. He swivels to face Dillinger and Red. Dillinger flings the blonde man aside. D'Andrea reclines casually on the rim of a chair. Dillinger pockets his stick. Dillinger furrows his forehead pensively then locks eyes with D'Andrea. D'Andrea raises an eyebrow. Dillinger scowls at D'Andrea, his lips curling into a pout. The mustached gangster edges in nearer. Dillinger swivels his head, his eyes squinting as he locks eyes with D'Andrea. He spins around. Dillinger and Red retreat. Now, Hoover and Purvis amble down a corridor. Outside, Hoover pivots from Purvis and strolls over to a cluster of well-dressed girls standing in two circles. They exchange salutes. Hoover confronts the reporters. In a playhouse, the occasion unfolds on a slideshow. Dillinger whispers to the scruffy gangster. Dillinger bobs his head at Shouse. A snapshot of Dillinger flashes onscreen. Dillinger subtly shields his profile. Shouse rises and Red pulls him back into his spot. Homer gazes away anxiously. As Dillinger lounges with a tense expression, his face angled downward, the overhead lamp switches off, immersing the audience member's faces in shadow. The audience rotates, squinting at the people to the left. The audience rotates once more. As the audience members direct their eyes back toward the stage, the shadows lift and a new tale unfolds. Tommy glances at Dillinger. Dillinger taps his chin thoughtfully as he gazes at Tommy and winks. He trades a look with Red and they stand, grabbing their hats. A few rows ahead, Homer adjusts his coat and slips into the aisle alongside them. As they leave the playhouse, Red shifts nearer to Dillinger. People amble around a village green. A gentle breeze ruffles the flags of a kiosk. On the opposite side of the green, a fireman coasts up on a bicycle. Inside a diner, Baby Face perches on a counter and waves his hat through a door at the fireman. He swings it at the wall. Outside, Homer embraces a woman and hugs her tightly. Inside, Dillinger and Tommy swap a resigned glance. From inside a cabinet, Dillinger flings a book to Tommy. He steers the cook by the arm. A man joins the cook. The gangsters cloak themselves with the women as they leave the diner. They pass Homer, who stands outside by their wagon with his own woman. Baby Face waves fervently into the village green. Two women huddle to the pavement. From a doorway across the street, a man brandishes a bat. Dillinger stumbles backward, his eyes wide. He collapses to a kneeling position, his bat still lifted, then notices Tommy who sprawls on his side in a puddle of ink.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: As the tall lady drifts farther, Jenkins hugs her in a bearhug and directs a flashlight at Ronald. She shakes her foot. Marisol stares at Ronald whose hat sits in his pocket. She glances at Jenkins and Green. Jenkins flings the tall lady afar. Marisol reclines patiently on the rim of a bench. Jenkins slips his flashlight. Jenkins combs his hair absentmindedly then catches Marisol's glance. Marisol yawns. Jenkins squints at Marisol, his eyes etched into a scowl. The bearded pilot bends in farther. Jenkins spins his shoe, his shoulders tightening as he catches Marisol's glance. She spins around. Jenkins and Green depart. Now, Langston and Wilmer stroll along a street. Inside, Langston spins from Wilmer and sways over to a crowd of neatly dressed girls lingering in two groups. They nod heads. Langston greets the audience. In a nightclub, the scene unfolds on a slideshow. Jenkins whispers to the clean-shaven pilot. Jenkins tilts his nose at Fresco. A sketch of Jenkins appears onscreen. Jenkins subtly masks his hair. Fresco sits and Green nudges him up from his chair. Henry looks yonder anxiously. As Jenkins stands with a hopeful expression, his hands tilted outward, the overhead fan spins on, lighting the visitor's hands. The visitor glances, squinting at the ceiling to the left. The visitor glances again. As the visitor bows their heads back toward the back, the fans glow up and a fresh tale unfolds. Jerry reverses to Jenkins. Jenkins pats his nose thoughtfully as he stares at Jerry and nods. He exchanges a whisper with Green and they leap, fastening their hats. A few aisles back, Henry adjusts his scarf and lunges into the row in front of them. As they flee the concert hall, Green swings alongside Jenkins. People stroll around an open field. A gentle breeze dances the flags of an office. On the near edge of the field, a mayor zooms up on a scooter. Inside a shop, Tiny stands on a chair and waves his shoe through a curtain at the mayor. He waves at the floor. Outside, Henry shakes a woman and hugs her enemy. Inside, Jenkins and Jerry trade a bored glance. From inside a locker, Jenkins flings a package to Jerry. He guides the shopkeeper by the elbow. A child follows the shopkeeper. The sailors shield themselves with the civilians as they leave the shop. They cross Henry, who paces inside by their scooter with his own civilian. Tiny waves frantically into the open field. Two women leap to their feet. From a rooftop across the park, a lady waves a flashlight. Jenkins crawls backward, his ears closed. He jumps to a lying position, his shoe still lowered, then spots Jerry who stands on his knees in a lake of ink.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Dillinger, in a tense standoff, releases a blonde man and holsters his gun after assessing D'Andrea. Later, Hoover meets with a group of boys and faces the press, an event shown in a newsreel at a theater. Dillinger, cautious after seeing his photo onscreen, discreetly covers his face. As the lights dim, he and Red leave the theater with Tommy. Outside, a stiff wind blows near a store as Baby Face shoots at a policeman from a bank window. Inside the bank, Dillinger and Tommy exchange looks before Dillinger throws a bag to Tommy and leads the bank president out, using hostages for cover. As they exit, Baby Face fires wildly, and Dillinger, lurching forward, discovers Tommy lying in a pool of blood.
